recommendations: Sargam Agarwal “I got the pleasure to work with Pratyush in the same team during our MLH Prep Fellowship. I found Pratyush to be very interested and curious in working with and learning new things. He used to actively participate in all the team activities so much so that he used to be the first one to complete them. He is great to work with in a team. He was always very helpful and approachable. He used to offer his time and help wherever he could. I found him to be a detail oriented individual as well. He figured out a minute bug in our website that was as a result, displaying wrong info and fixed it. Ever ready to collaborate with him again :)”

current_company_name: D. E. Shaw India Private Limited
projects: [{"title":"Anytime Food","start_date":"Feb 2022","end_date":"Mar 2022","description":"A project developed for the OpenSoft Competition in General Championship held at IIT Kharagpur. I was the captain of a team consisting of 25 members.• Developed microservices for orders, deliveries, and user and restaurant profiles for the restaurant‑chain app• Implemented hybrid cloud facility for always keeping order and delivery microservices up using a private and public database• Used Django REST Framework for backend, React for frontend and containerized the microservices using Docker• Developed a dashboard to indicate the uptime/downtime status of the data centre and restaurant chains• Working on a container management platform to ease the management and deployment of this containerized and microservices architecture"},{},{},{"title":"Iflaunta","start_date":"Nov 2021","end_date":"Dec 2021","description":"• Developed the entire backend of a platform which analyses the Video response of users and provides results in predefined factors• Used Django REST Framework for backend and IBM Watson speech‑to‑text service library for getting transcripts of the response• Implemented token‑based Authentication (JSON Web Tokens) and implemented API Authorisation based on user permissions• Created unit and integration tests for developed functionality, keeping in mind all possible aspects of Agile Test Methodology• Participated in the frontend and backend integration and authored the API Documentation on Notion"},{"title":"DOCLIB","start_date":"Feb 2021","end_date":"Apr 2021","description":"Built a document library that integrates with multiple data sources (like digiLocker, Google Drive, local storage etc.) and storage services (like S3 and Google Cloud Storage) and uploads data from these data sources to the chosen storage service. It can be integrated with any Django Project."},{},{"title":"XMEME","start_date":"Jan 2021","end_date":"Feb 2021","description":"Built a Full Stack application for a Meme Stream Page where users can post memes by providing their name, a caption for the meme and the URL for the meme image as input"},{"title":"Design and Implementation of SRAM cell using CMOS technology","start_date":"Oct 2020","end_date":"Nov 2020","description":"Course Project for Digital Electronics under Prof. Gautam Saha, IIT Kharagpur• Designed a CMOS technology based 6T SRAM Cell and verified different modes of operation of the cell on LTSpice• Fine-tuned Cell Ratio and Pull Up Ratio constraints to ensure read/write stability for preventing errors like over-write or failure to write"},{"title":"Active Power Distribution Board, PCB Designing","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"May 2019","description":"An active power distribution board distributes the power coming from the battery in the whole drone and reads the battery's data logs like the current supplied and voltage. The task was to design the schematic circuit of an active PDB comprising many components, including currents sensors, voltage sensors, and constant voltage providers for the different components of the drones. Different sensors and ICs and corresponding datasheets were studied."},{},{},{"title":"Fully Printed Drone","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"May 2019","description":"The task was to design a PCB of a fully printed drone considering Crazyflie, a nano quadcopter for reference. Datasheets of different components were studied and analyzed, and then the schematic of the printed circuit board of the drone was made. Working on this Crazyflie 2.0, different electronic circuits like the microcontroller, different sensor controllers, and more were studied. I got the chance to read about other communications like Serial Peripheral Interference, Inter-Integrated Circuit, and UART."},{},{}]

honors_and_awards.title: Nexus | Robotix Event
honors_and_awards.description: • Won Best Algorithm in Nexus Computer Vision event in which the autonomous bot had to follow different coloured circles • Applied Image Processing on a camera to make decisions on travel direction based on shape identification and reading bar-codes • Implemented a PID Controller on Arduino to regulate the linear and angular velocity of the motors based on the estimated turning angle
